image.altText: Jasmine smiles while wearing a red jacket and black wide-brimmed hat with a cream underside

props.synopsis: A mother standing trial for the alleged criminal neglect and manslaughter of her daughter made the girl hit herself, locked her in an alarmed room and cut off most of her hair, a court has heard. Warning: This story includes references to child abuse and self-harm, which may be distressing to readers.

title.children: Court hears from child who witnessed alleged abuse in manslaughter neglect case

image.altText: The South Australia Police logo on a building.

props.synopsis: South Australia police say several searches have been carried out on multiple premises in the Anangu Pitjantjatjara Yankunytjatjara Lands, including the administration offices in Umuwa.

title.children: Anti-corruption police raid APY Lands administration office

image.altText: A woman with grey hair and a white rollneck sweater

props.synopsis: With 12 months still left of her term, a well-known South Australian mayor has been ousted by fellow councillors, but she has challenged them to offer a "legitimate reason" for her dismissal.

title.children: SA mayor removed by colleagues says she has done nothing wrong

image.altText: SA Premier Peter Malinauskas at a media conference.

props.synopsis: South Australian Premier Peter Malinauskas has not given up hope for Adelaide to potentially host the UN climate summit in the future, after Australia ceded the hosting rights for next year's event to Türkiye.

title.children: Hotels 'disappointed' by COP31 loss, but SA Premier suggests future bid

image.altText: A farmer leans on a post in front of cows.

props.synopsis: South Australia's mining minister now has the power to extend mining leases, which farmers say makes the future of their land "uncertain".

title.children: Farmers say new mining laws create 'uncertainty' for their futures

image.altText: the front gate of mine with the sign SIMEC

props.synopsis: A restriction on Tahmoor Coal's licence will not be removed until $29.4 million in outstanding royalties are paid to the NSW government.

title.children: NSW tells Gupta we’re not giving you any special treatment, pay your debts first

image.altText: Image of pink patties on a conveyer belt.

props.synopsis: The world is facing a crisis in food production and alternative sources of protein can be part of the solution, but the fledgling Australian sector is struggling.

title.children: Producing alternative proteins for vegans is not as easy as you think

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and tie speaks to microphones on stands in front of glass windows

props.synopsis: The SA and ACT education ministers are calling for a national inquiry into how coloured play sand contaminated with asbestos was imported into the country, with more than 450 SA Department for Education sites now impacted.

title.children: ACT joins SA in calls for urgent national inquiry into asbestos sand

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt stands between tall warehouse shelves, some are empty

props.synopsis: Creditors of disability employer Bedford are concerned they will not see money repaid, as the company prepares for sale to secure its future.

title.children: Bedford supplier says he has not 'received a cent' of $50,000 owed

image.altText: UniSA's City West campus with the University of Adelaide medical building.

props.synopsis: The co-vice chancellors of the new Adelaide University says the mammoth task of merging two universities has its own complexities.

title.children: Nothing like Adelaide uni merger 'has been attempted in Australia before'

image.altText: The tail of a dead fish lying in some sand.

props.synopsis: The South Australian opposition has pledged a $21-million voluntary fisheries buyback scheme, if it is elected next year, to allow commercial fishers to leave the industry amid the harmful algal bloom.

title.children: SA opposition promises buyback opportunity for commercial fishers

image.altText: BOM track map shows Tropical Cyclone Fina making landfall near Minjilang, then passing between the Tiwi Islands and Darwin.

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology says communities between Cape Don on the Cobourg Peninsula and Maningrida — including Minjilang and Warruwi — are set to be the first to experience the impacts of the category two system, from late Friday.

title.children: Cyclone Fina set to impact NT coastal communities from late Friday

image.altText: Jake and Callum Robinson stand next to each other and smile.

props.synopsis: A woman has been sentenced to 20 years in jail for her role in a robbery in which three men, including two Australian brothers, were killed in Mexico last year.

title.children: Mexican woman sentenced to 20-year jail term for role in brothers' killings

image.altText: A close-up of the back of a police sedan with a focus on a '000 Emergency' sticker

props.synopsis: Police officers pepper sprayed an 87-year-old man in a nursing home in south-west Sydney after he was seen brandishing "a metal ornament".

title.children: Review launched as police pepper spray 87yo man in Sydney nursing home

image.altText: An England cricket player is pictured standing on the ground in a purple top and cap before a tour match.

props.synopsis: England's wicketkeeper for the Ashes series may look unassuming but as Russell Jackson writes, if Australia underestimates Jamie Smith, they will do so at their peril.

title.children: Why Jamie Smith could be England's unlikely Ashes hero

image.altText: Donald Trump looks on as he sits at a desk wearing a dark suit and blue tie.

props.synopsis: Trump's absence could neuter the forum's ability to move the dial on the summit's priorities, including helping nations adapt to weather disasters, the transition to clean energy, cutting excessive debt costs and working together in the global rush for critical minerals.

title.children: G20 leaders are 'saving the furniture' as Trump leads a boycott

image.altText: Nathan McKeown Arnie the German shepherd

props.synopsis: Queensland Police had been investigating the alleged theft of a vehicle and Arnie the German shepherd, from Brisbane's bayside.

title.children: Owner charged over allegedly abandoning dog Arnie after claiming he was stolen

image.altText: A woman in a dark hijab holds a baby while leaning against the wall of a modest home.

props.synopsis: The kidnappers arrived on motorcycles, scaled the school fence and shot the vice-principal as he tried to protect his students.

title.children: Nigeria grapples with mass abductions of schoolgirls

image.altText: Richard, left, and Janette, right, stand together and pose for a formal image in their modern home featuring indoor garden.

props.synopsis: Only someone whose family has long lived next to a river famous for catastrophic flooding would dare to build on this block. Here's what we can all learn from Richard and Janette's new home.

title.children: What we can learn from this $2m new-build on a flood-prone block

image.altText: three astronauts smile and stack their hands together

props.synopsis: It was November 20, 1998, and a rocket wasn't an unusual sight in this remote part of Kazakhstan. But today's cargo was a piece of history that would have seemed impossible just years before.

title.children: How Cold War foes became close colleagues — until toilets got in the way

image.altText: woman looking shocked at her phone in bed

props.synopsis: Whether it's controversy around a jeans ad, voting for a political party you disagree with, or criminal allegations, it can feel confronting to learn more about a person you admire.

title.children: 'It shatters that image you had': When celebrities and artists disappoint us

image.altText: A woman with a white jacket talking to the camera

props.synopsis: A senior secondary teacher says an error like the one found on the Tasmanian Certificate of Education legal studies exam paper "is really bad", as the education minister moves to assure students the errors would not affect end-of-year results.

title.children: 'Huge outrage' as Tasmanian students grapple with exam issues

image.altText: Two teenagers stand on phones in front of a Facebook logo

props.synopsis: Meta warns it will start axing the Meta accounts of under 16s from December 4. Here's how you can download your data before then.

title.children: How to download your content ahead of Meta's teen social media ban

image.altText: Julia Morris, left, poses in a composite image next to Guy Sebastian, right, doing the same.

props.synopsis: Stars including Anne Edmonds, Sam Pang and Shaun Tan are attached to the ABC's 2026 line-up with old audience favourites and new series coming next year.

title.children: ABC unveils 2026 line-up with new faces Julia Morris and Guy Sebastian

image.altText: Toyah Cordingley smiling as she sits in front of a Christmas tree.

props.synopsis: Police compiled the CCTV and traffic camera vision by tracking a car registered to Rajwinder Singh before Toyah Cordingley was allegedly murdered.

title.children: CCTV of accused before alleged Toyah Cordingley murder played to jury

image.altText: Jace Austin, father of Ben Austin kisses a rose on the coffin during his son's funeral.

props.synopsis: Melbourne's Junction Oval was a sea of cricket shirts, football jumpers and scarves as friends and family gathered to farewell beloved teenager Ben Austin, who died in a tragic cricket accident last month.

title.children: 'Champion young man' who died in cricketing accident farewelled

image.altText: Shepparton car thief leaves baby in a box

props.synopsis: Police search for a man who stole a car with a sleeping baby in the back seat from a supermarket car park in northern Victoria, before dumping the child in a box and driving away.

title.children: Hunt continues for man who stole car with baby inside and dumped him in box

image.altText: A group of Aboriginal family members.

props.synopsis: The family of a 17-year-old Indigenous boy says he was racially profiled when he was pulled from a Canberra bus by police officers who handcuffed him before realising he was the wrong person.

title.children: Aboriginal teen mistakenly pulled from bus at gunpoint after 'racial profiling'

image.altText: The family of killed teen Ethan Hoac hold his photo outside the Supreme Court of Victoria

props.synopsis: The killer of Ethan Hoac — who was murdered in an unprovoked attack in Melbourne's north-west in 2023 — is sentenced to more than a decade behind bars for a crime labelled "appalling" and "vicious".

title.children: Judge says horror of 14-year-old boy's murder 'hard to comprehend'

image.altText: A black and white photo of a naval vessel at sea, taken from a bird's eye perspective.

props.synopsis: The Russian vessel had directed lasers at pilots of surveillance aircraft monitoring its activities.

title.children: 'We see you': UK warns Russia as spy ship nears British waters

image.altText: A woman's left hand strikes lettered keys on a computer keyboard with fingers that have painted fingernails.

props.synopsis: Australia's mining and manufacturing sectors are taking up to two years to notice and report cyber breaches to authorities, prompting concerns about the data security of industries critical to the nation's economy.

title.children: Data of up to 3.6m people exposed in cyber breaches, FOI shows

image.altText: A child drinks water from a bubbler.

props.synopsis: Large studies conclude there is no evidence to back up community concerns that fluoride in water at recommended levels may affect the cognition or IQ of children.

title.children: Is fluoride in water toxic? Here's what decades of research tells us

image.altText: Oscar Piastri of Australia and McLaren walks in the paddock, with cameras on him

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri enters the third-last grand prix of the season further away from the drivers' championship lead than he has been all year.

title.children: How to follow Oscar Piastri during the F1 grand prix in Las Vegas
